subject: Learning
title: The Myth of Natural Talent
description: A fast breakdown of The Myth of Natural Talent for builders.

hook.text: Mozart composed at age 5. He must have been born with it. But the full story is more complicated.

buildup.text: Mozart's father was a professional musician who began intense training when Wolfgang was three.

discovery.text: Anders Ericsson found that expertise requires roughly 10,000 hours of deliberate practice in any field.

twist.text: What looks like natural talent is often an invisible head start: early exposure, resources, and coaching.

climax.text: Genetics set a range of potential. Practice determines where in that range you land.

punchline.text: Talent opens the door. Practice walks through it.

quiz.question: What did Anders Ericsson's research reveal about expertise?
options: It requires roughly 10,000 hours of deliberate practice
Practice has no effect on skill development
